The video was prepared in the best, and many thanks for sharing. I just want to add a caution to the procedure. It's better not to use DCM for extracting when using an excess amount of NaOH. CHCl3 in trace amount can participate in reimer timer reaction. So better to use K2CO3 for neutrlizing without problem with DCM or using Ether for extract in the epresence of excess NaOH. good luck!

From your previous video (synthesis of phenylhydrazine HCl), 4.6 mL aniline -> 5.5 g phenylhydrazine at 100% yield. You crashed it out from 100 mL water, which can dissolve 5 g phenylhydrazine HCl (solubility = 50 mg/mL) (you lose less because the water had other salts in it). => You lost most of the phenylhydrazine as its HCl salt into the water from which you first precipitated it in the aniline to phenylhydrazine HCl video.
